name: Diamond Reversi
description:
This is a variant of Reversi game, a prototype made for NYU Game Center Prototype Studio.

Prompt: 

Rules:

Starting from four corners, the Red and the Blue take turns to occupy the grids. 

In each turn, the player need to tint 1 grid of other neutral colors (not red/blue ones), and then optionally merge 4 grid of the same size into 1 bigger grid.

When the grid is tinted, it functions as the piece in Reversi games, which means that all of the opponent's or the neutral pieces between your pieces are then turned over to become your color. Importantly, this is only effective when the turned grids are all in one color!

The bigger grids can't be turned over to other colors, so they would defend your other 1x1 grids territory.

When neutral color grids are eliminated, the game ends. The player who has the larger territory wins.

Controls:

Mouse to click

R to restart
